phrs.translation: 绝对多数制, 超级多数, 绝对多数

sentences.sentence: The supermajority rule would be no bad thing if it forced the majority party to reach out to the other side.
sentences.translation: 超级多数的规则在使得多数党考虑另一方意见上的确不是一件坏事。

sentences.sentence: Of course Mr Obama could get things done when he had a supermajority, and the stimulus even passed without one.
sentences.translation: 想当然尔，欧巴马在有超级多数时可以把事情完成，而他甚至不需要超级多数来通过经济刺激方案。

sentences.sentence: To put the vote on the ballot the traditional way, Mr Brown needs a supermajority (two-thirds) in the legislature.
sentences.translation: 采用传统方式以不记名形式投票，布朗需要在议会有绝对多数（至少三分之二）的支持率。
